content.raw: I decided to upgrade to ignition-cmake2 because we would need to use ignition-cmake1 in our current workspace along with cmake2. I didn't know that changing to ign-cmake2 could affect xenial builds. Can both of them coexist? Is that supported? Currently if I try to use both of them,  then one of our packages links against transport5, which uses `ignition-cmake1::utilities` library but it's not found by CMake. I have to call `find_package(ignition-cmake1 REQUIRED)` even though I’m not using it directly.
content.html: I decided to upgrade to ignition-cmake2 because we would need to use ignition-cmake1 in our current workspace along with cmake2. I didn't know that changing to ign-cmake2 could affect xenial builds. Can both of them coexist? Is that supported? Currently if I try to use both of them, then one of our packages links against transport5, which uses ignition-cmake1::utilities library but it's not found by CMake. I have to call find_package(ignition-cmake1 REQUIRED) even though I’m not using it directly.
